text:

title: Analysis
text:
Load Cleaned Data
The following code uses the datasets created in the Initial Exploration that precedes the Analysis section. The datasets are saved to CSV as data/2025-12-23_csp-pub.csv (each row is a unique citizen science project-publication combination) and data/2025-09-24_pub.csv (each row is an individual publication).

# Unique citizen science project-publication combinations (N = 377)
df_csp = read_csv("data/2025-12-23_csp-pub.csv")

# Individual publications (N = 277)
df_pub = read_csv("data/2025-09-24_pub.csv")

title: Analysis
text:
Data Exploration

Citizen Science Projects


Code
df_csp %>% 
  group_by(cs_project_grouped) %>% 
  summarise(count = n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(count)) %>% 
  print(n = "all")


# A tibble: 9 × 2
  cs_project_grouped count
  <chr>              <int>
1 infrequent           132
2 BBS                   85
3 eBird                 45
4 BBA                   34
5 CBC                   28
6 MMP                   22
7 CMMN                  11
8 NHS                   10
9 PFW                   10




Citizen Science Terminology


Number of Citizen Science Projects


Code
# all counts
df_pub %>% 
  group_by(cs_count) %>% 
  summarise(count = n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(count)) %>% 
  print(n = "all")


# A tibble: 8 × 2
  cs_count count
     <dbl> <int>
1        1   220
2        2    37
3        3    15
4        4     1
5        6     1
6        7     1
7       10     1
8       11     1


Code
# one use vs 2+ uses
df_pub %>% 
  mutate(cs_count_group = case_when(
    cs_count == 1 ~ "1",
    cs_count >= 2 ~ "2+"
    )) %>% 
  group_by(cs_count_group) %>% 
  summarise(count = n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(count)) %>% 
  print(n = "all")


# A tibble: 2 × 2
  cs_count_group count
  <chr>          <int>
1 1                220
2 2+                57


Is there a change in how many citizen science projects are used per publication over time?

Logistic regression model (1 = multiple data sets, 0 = single dataset)


Code
df_pub$multiple_datasets = ifelse(df_pub$cs_count >= 2, 1, 0)

model_logit_multi = glm(multiple_datasets ~ publication_year, family = binomial, data = df_pub)

summary(model_logit_multi)



Call:
glm(formula = multiple_datasets ~ publication_year, family = binomial, 
    data = df_pub)

Coefficients:
                  Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|)
(Intercept)      -48.25447   32.45714  -1.487    0.137
publication_year   0.02329    0.01611   1.446    0.148

(Dispersion parameter for binomial family taken to be 1)

    Null deviance: 281.60  on 276  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 279.35  on 275  degrees of freedom
AIC: 283.35

Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 4

df_csp %>% 
  count(cs_count, cs_project_grouped) %>%

    values_from = n,
    values_fill = 0
  ) %>% 
  janitor::adorn_totals(c("row"))

Transparency
Is citizen science acknowledged at all in the publication?


Code
df_csp %>% 
  mutate(y_n = case_when(
    transp_rank == 0 ~ "No",
    transp_rank >= 1 ~ "Yes"))%>% 
  group_by(y_n) %>% 
  summarise(count = n())


# A tibble: 2 × 2
  y_n   count
  <chr> <int>
1 No       97

What is the frequency of transparent vs not transparent attribution cases for each citizen science project?


Code
transp_rank_crosstab = 
df_csp %>% 
  group_by(rank_group, 
           cs_project_grouped) %>% 
  summarise(count = n(), .groups = "drop") %>% 
  spread(cs_project_grouped, count, fill = 0)

transp_rank_crosstab


# A tibble: 2 × 10
  rank_group        BBA   BBS   CBC  CMMN eBird infrequent   MMP   NHS   PFW
  <chr>           <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
1 Not transparent    23    56    16     9    18         42     8    10     2
2 Transparent        11    29    12     2    27         90    14     0     8


Code
chi_test_result = chisq.test(transp_rank_crosstab[ , -1], simulate.p.value = T)
print(chi_test_result)



    Pearson's Chi-squared test with simulated p-value (based on 2000
    replicates)

data:  transp_rank_crosstab[, -1]
X-squared = 52.144, df = NA, p-value = 0.0004998


Code
df_csp %>%
  count(cs_project_grouped, 
        rank_group, 
        name = "count") %>% # Count observations per category
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(cs_project_grouped, 
                         count), # reorder columns by desc count
             y = count, 
             fill = rank_group)) +  
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +  
  labs(x = "Citizen Science Project", 
       y = "Number of Cases") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Transparent" = "#ffc000", 
                               "Not transparent" = "#156082")) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank())

title: Analysis
text:
Main Figure


Code
df_csp %>% 
  group_by(publication_year, transparency_bin) %>%
  summarise(count = n(), .groups = "drop") %>%
  mutate(status = ifelse(transparency_bin == 1, "Transparent", "Not Transparent")) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = publication_year,
             y = count,
             fill = status)) +
  geom_area(alpha = 0.8) +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("Transparent" = "#ffc000",
                               "Not Transparent" = "#156082")) +
  labs(x = "Publication Year",
       y = "Number of Cases") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(legend.position = "bottom",
        legend.title = element_blank())

title: Data Cleaning and Dataset Creation
text:
This is the initial data cleaning and manipulations to create the final datasets used in the Analysis. The final datasets are saved to CSV as:

Unique Publications: data/publication_clean.csv where each row is an individual publication, to facilitate analysis at the level of the publication
Citizen Science Project-Publication Cases: data/csp_publication_clean.csv where each row is a unique citizen science project-publication combination, to facilitate analysis at the level of the citizen science project

Journal Impact Factors
from Clarivate Journal Citation Report
First we extracted the names of all the journals that were represented in the included publications.


Code
journal_list = 
  df_publication %>% 
  group_by(source_title) %>% 
  summarise(count = n()) %>% 
  arrange(desc(count))

# Save list as a csv
write.csv(journal_list, file = "data/journal_list.csv")


Using this list, we searched for each journal in the Clarivate Journal Citation Report database, exported all available journal impact factor data, and merged it into one master file.

Citizen Science Project-Publication Cases
Final dataset 2) data/csp_publication_clean.csv where each row is a unique citizen science project-publication combination, to facilitate analysis at the level of the citizen science project.
We separated out each unique citizen science project-publication case through a mix of data extraction in Covidence and Excel.
